New Records: Cameron Green scored 61 runs off 30 balls in his first innings as an opener.
Hardik Pandya scored 71 runs off 30 balls, the fastest fifty in an innings for India.
Key Match Events: Cameron Green and Matthew Wade's partnership of 99 runs in 20 overs was the highest third-wicket partnership for Australia in T20I history.
Tim David was dismissed on his debut, but his 18 runs off 14 balls showed promise.
Axar Patel took 3 wickets for 17 runs, the most economical bowling performance of the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Australia's opening pair of Cameron Green and Matthew Wade were expected to provide a strong start, which they did with 99 runs in 13.1 overs.
India's bowling attack, missing Jasprit Bumrah, was under pressure to contain Australia's chase.
Post-Match Reflections: Australia's win gave them a 1-0 lead in the series, while India faced questions about their fielding and death bowling.
Hardik Pandya's performance was praised as a bright spot for India despite the loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the second time Australia successfully chased down a target of over 200 in T20I cricket.
The match was played under normal conditions with no significant interruptions.
Others: The match was the first of a three-match series between the two teams.
